result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Cole Lepak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 2 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
-Court costs, DNA surcharge and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 8/18/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in court with Gabriela Leija under the student practice rule and under the supervision of attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Phyllis M. DeCarvalho appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State filed an amended information amending the charge to: Possession of Prescription Drug without a Valid Prescription, pursuant to Wis Stat 450.11(7)(h), 450.11(9)(a), an unclassified Misdemeanor.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on motion to suppress proceeds.  Sworn-in for the State:  City of Franklin Police Officer John Kosterman.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments by counsel.   Court finds the officer had a reasonable and articulable suspicion to stop the defendant; the defendant voluntarily consented to a search and the officer had a legal basis to search the defendant.  Court denies the motion to suppress.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
State's Response to Motion to Suppress, filed. cmt

Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges copy of a receipt of the Information, waives reading and plead not guilty.  Motions to be filed by 5-12-14; response by 5-23-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Fruits of Illegal Search and Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Fruits of Illegal Stop received and filed./ds
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in court with attorney Reyna Morales for Anne M Jaspers.  Paul Hauer for Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Arraignment scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/11/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Daniel Cole Lepak in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
